message.content:
I'll analyze the cash flow statement to identify the net addition in cash and cash equivalents, along with its component sub-items.

Looking at the cash flow statement:

1. The "Net Increase" line item explicitly shows the net change in cash and cash equivalents: -593035.27

2. This can be decomposed into two components:
   - "Beginning Balance" of cash and cash equivalents: 8000000.00
   - "Ending Balance" of cash and cash equivalents: 7406964.73

The net increase (-593035.27) represents the difference between the ending balance and beginning balance (7406964.73 - 8000000.00 = -593035.27).

This negative value indicates a net decrease in cash and cash equivalents during the period.

{"solution": {'value': '-593035.27', 'sub_items': {'sub_item value1': '8000000.00', 'sub_item value2': '7406964.73'}}}
